item.title: The CJEU revives the old 'third pillar' with the EU Zombie Law.
item.description:

item.title: Is the European Arrest Warrant compatible with human rights? Can individuals be legally detained for more than 90 days before being surrendered?
item.description:

Dutch law mandates the release of a requested individual after 90 days if the court hasn’t made a decision on the EAW. However, a 2015 European Court of Justice (CJEU) ruling stated that national courts can extend detention beyond 90 days to ensure conditions for surrender are met...

item.description:
